titles.title: Betty Dick Residence Protection Act
Betty Dick Residence Protection Act
Betty Dick Residence Protection Act
Betty Dick Residence Protection Act
A bill to require the Secretary of the Interior to allow the continued occupancy and use of certain land and improvements within Rocky Mountain National Park.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 109-201.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 109-426.

calendar.text: Placed on the Private Calendar, Calendar No. 2.

action.text: Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 4/25/2006--Reported to House without amendment. Betty Dick Residence Protection Act - Requires the Secretary of the Interior to allow Betty Dick to continue to occupy and use specified land within the boundaries of Rocky Mountain National Park for the remainder of her natural life, subject to the payment of a specified annual amount to the Secretary. Prohibits: (1) the extension of the right of occupancy to any individual other than Betty Dick; and (2) any construction not in existence on November 30, 2004. Requires public access to both banks of the main channel of the Colorado River.
